text: seven years ago today I moved to Prague
to study abroad it was my first trip
overseas and I was instantly hooked as
my eyes and ears were opened up to the
world
fast forward to 2019 and I am closing in
to my goal to visit every single country
in the world
[Music]
it has been a wild journey so far and
I've learned so much about myself our
incredible world and the seven point six
billion people living in it
the following are my top ten takeaways
from a hundred and fifty three countries
one we are lucky if you're reading this
that means you have internet which half
of the world still doesn't have you also
own a computer a smartphone and have
some kind of Education likely of a
higher degree do you realize how much
opportunity you have after seeing the
world's most excruciatingly poverty I've
learned to always be grateful for the
life I live to 99.9% of people are
friendly welcome tabula welcome to no
matter what your race religion or
ethnicity is I find that the vast
majority of humans are kind hospitable
and would genuinely love to meet you the
media does a horrible job of showing
this by highlighting all the negatives
in the world but I urge you not to make
judgments on a country culture or group
of people until you meet with them I 2 I
3 appreciate diversity the world would
be very boring if everyone looked like
you spoke the same language as you and
do the same things that you do every day
diversity is what makes the world go
round
it makes cultures flourish and it makes
discovering them all the more exciting
and unique 4 get up early early mornings
are the best time to explore any place
there's something magical about waking
up before anyone else does
to see the city life or nature life
unfold get outdoors be active go hiking
play golf or just sit on a bench in the
park and do nothing but observe these
are some of my favorite moments 5 family
first but also good friends no matter
where life takes you family is the most
important thing you have to love and
cherish it's important to respect your
parents because they are the ones who
created you love your brothers sisters
aunts uncles and cousins and especially
call your grandparents more often having
a few close friends is also important
because they are the ones you can call
whenever there's a problem in life and
always make sure to be surrounding
yourself with people who make you a
better person
6 everyone has the same wants and needs
it doesn't matter if you're black or
white rich or poor healthy or sick I've
every person has the same desires we all
want to love and be loved we all laugh
when something's funny and cry when we
feel sad we all need to eat when we're
hungry and have a roof over our heads to
sleep if everyone could understand and
appreciate these basic values then
racism would be greatly reduced
7 stop being so frugal I get it
you're travelling on a budget who isn't
but you need to understand that spending
a little more upfront will lead to less
down the road it's worth it to spend 10
dollars more for a nicer hotel if that
means you'll get a good night's rest and
not be tired the next day it's worth
spending an extra fifty bucks for a
private driver in a dangerous area to
ensure you'll be safe over a random taxi
driver and sometimes it's just nice to
treat yourself I recommend to stop
keeping track of every penny like I used
to do because you are just wasting your
time eight less is more
all of my possessions fit into these two
carry-on bags and they've gotten smaller
as time passed this was my first
backpack in 2013 when you're old and you
look back on your travels you're never
gonna remember the clothes you wore that
day but you will always remember the
experiences you had 9 learn by asking
questions the way I learn almost
everything is by asking and it has made
me a more well-rounded person
four months ago when I was in Equatorial
Guinea hola buenos tardes
hola is in my level I asked my local
friend a thousand questions about their
culture and society and now I can tell
you almost anything that you'd like to
know about the country which leads me to
my final point ten the more I travel the
more I realize how little I know
visiting new places makes me realize how
ignorant I am about other people
lifestyles and cultures every day of my
life is a new learning experience I
didn't know about Cameroon civil war
until I was there and saw bullets on the
road I didn't know why some tight women
stretched their necks until I went to a
small village in the north nor did I
know about the betelnut academic until I
went to Papua New Guinea traveling is a
never-ending learning cycle lastly I
just like to end with one more thought
traveling has made me realized that the
world is far from perfect there's still
a lot more that can be done to make the
world a better cleaner and safer place
and it starts with me and
you i'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click subscribe and
join me as i plan to visit every country
in the world it's electric it's sexy
it's tasty it's confusing but above all
its futuristic the Japanese are
innovators they somehow
